title: LCZ4r Local Functions
text: lcz_ts() function, can analyze air temperature associated LCZ classes time. instance, can perform hourly frequency analysis air temperature Berlin years 2019-2020 using “lcz_data” LCZ4r package.  Additionally, can customize function: 1. Flexibility time selection flexibility select specific years months analysis. example, can specify range years (e.g., 1998:2004) individual years (e.g., c(1998, 2004)). Similarly, can select months either numerically (e.g., 1:6 January June) name (e.g., c(“January”, “December”)). illustrate, can select data September 1st, 2019, including arguments “year”, “month”, “day” function call. See utility functions openair package details.  2. Splitting LCZ time series temporal window site can split data frame calling argument. split available “year”, “season”, “seasonyear”, “month”, “monthyear”, “weekday”, “weekend”, “daylight” (daytime nighttime). See argument type openair package:
code: # Get the LCZ map for your city lcz_map <- lcz_get_map_euro(city="Berlin")  #Let's get LCZ air temperature time series lcz_ts(lcz_map,         data_frame = lcz_data,         var = "airT",         station_id = "station",        time.freq = "month") # Monthly temporal frequency. Let's change to "hour, "day", "week", and so on. #Selecting a couple of months lcz_ts(lcz_map, data_frame = lcz_data,         var = "airT", station_id = "station",        time.freq = "hour",         year = 2019, month = 1:3)

what: Assess LCZ for Urban Heat Island Intensity
title: LCZ4r Local Functions
text: lcz_uhi_intensity() function designed calculate Urban Heat Island (UHI) intensity based air temperature measurements Local Climate Zones (LCZ). provides two methods calculate UHI intensity (UHII): LCZ manual. LCZ method, functions automatically identifies LCZ build types, starting LCZ 1 progressing LCZ 10, represent urban temperature, whilst starts LCZ natural LCZ (11-16) represent rural temperature. manual method, users freedom select stations references urban rural areas.
code: #Calculate hourly UHI intensity by months of 2019 lcz_uhi_intensity(lcz_map, data_frame = lcz_data,         var = "airT", station_id = "station",        time.freq = "hour",         group = TRUE,        method = "LCZ",        year = 2019:2020,        by = "month") #Calculate hourly UHI intensity by daytime and nighttime lcz_uhi_intensity(lcz_map, data_frame = lcz_data,         var = "airT", station_id = "station",        time.freq = "hour",         group = TRUE,        method = "LCZ",        year = 2019, month = 2, day = 6,        by = "daylight")

Specify one parameter names retrieve specific parameters. example, "SVF1" get minimum Sky View Factor, c("SVF1", "z0") select multiple parameters. istack Logical. TRUE, returns parameters raster stack. FALSE, returns list individual parameter rasters. ishp Logical. TRUE, returns parameters ESRI shapefile. isave Set TRUE want save clipped resulting map raster.tiff .shp file local machine.

title: Retrieve urban canopy LCZ parameters — lcz_get_parameters
text: 'istack' TRUE, returns raster stack containing 34 LCZ-related parameters. 'istack' FALSE, returns list individual parameter rasters. 'ishp' TRUE, returns ESRI shapefile containing parameters. 'iselect' specified, returns selected parameter(s) raster(s).

title: Retrieve urban canopy LCZ parameters — lcz_get_parameters
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Load the LCZ map lcz_map <- raster::raster("path/to/lcz_map.tif")  # Get LCZ parameters as a raster stack lcz_params_stack <- lcz_get_parameters(lcz_map, istack = TRUE)  # Get LCZ parameters as a list of individual parameter rasters lcz_params_list <- lcz_get_parameters(lcz_map, istack = FALSE)  # Access individual parameters from the list specific_param <- lcz_params_list$parameter_name  # Get specific parameters as a raster or shapefile selected_params <- lcz_get_parameters(lcz_map, iselect = c("SVF1", "VEG1")) } # }

code: lcz_interp_map(   x,   data_frame = "",   var = "",   station_id = "",   ...,   sp.res = 100,   tp.res = "hour",   vg.model = "Sph",   by = NULL,   impute = NULL,   isave = FALSE,   LCZinterp = TRUE )

title: Visualize the LCZ - interpolated map — lcz_interp_map
text: x SpatRaster object containing LCZ map. LCZ map can obtained using lcz_get_map() function. data_frame data frame containing air temperature measurements station IDs. data frame date field hourly higher resolution format. var Name variable interpolation, e.g. air temperature, dataframe. station_id Name station ID variable dataframe. ... Additional arguments selectBydata openair package. include: start date string form "1/2/1999" format "YYYY-mm-dd", e.g., "1999-02-01". year years select, e.g., year = 1998:2004 select 1998-2004 inclusive, year = c(1998, 2004) select 1998 2004. month months select. Can either numeric, e.g., month = 1:6 select January June, name, e.g., month = c("January", "December"). sp.res Spatial resolution unit meters interpolation. Default 100. tp.res Temporal resolution, time period average . Default “hour”, includes “day”, “week”, “month” “year”. vg.model kriging selected, list viogrammodels tested interpolated kriging. Default "Sph". model "Sph", "Exp", "Gau", "Ste". names respective shperical, exponential,gaussian,Matern familiy, Matern, M. Stein's parameterization. data frame time-serie split: “year”, “season”, “seasonyear”,  “month”, “monthyear”, “weekday”, “weekend”,  “site”, “daylight”(daytime nighttime).See argument type openair package:https://bookdown.org/david_carslaw/openair/sections/intro/openair-package.html#-type-option impute Method impute missing values (“mean”, “median”, “knn”, “bag”). isave Save plot directory. LCZinterp set TRUE (default), LCZ interpolation approach used. set FALSE, conventional interpolation without LCZ used.

title: Assess the Urban Heat Island Intensity — lcz_uhi_intensity
text: function calculates Urban Heat Island (UHI) intensity based air temperature measurements Local Climate Zones (LCZ). details: https://bymaxanjos.github.io/LCZ4r/articles/Introd_local_LCZ4r.html

title: Assess the Urban Heat Island Intensity — lcz_uhi_intensity
code: lcz_uhi_intensity(   x,   data_frame = "",   var = "",   station_id = "",   ...,   time.freq = "hour",   method = "LCZ",   Turban = NULL,   Trural = NULL,   by = NULL,   impute = NULL,   group = FALSE,   iplot = TRUE,   isave = FALSE,   ylab = "Air temperature [C]",   xlab = "Time",   ylab2 = "UHI",   title = "",   caption = "LCZ4r,2024" )

title: Assess the Urban Heat Island Intensity — lcz_uhi_intensity
text: x SpatRaster object containing LCZ map. LCZ map can obtained using lcz_get_map() function. data_frame data frame containing air temperature measurements station IDs. data frame date field hourly higher resolution format. var name variable data frame representing air temperature. station_id name variable data frame representing station IDs. ... Additional arguments selectBydata openair package. include: start date string form "1/2/1999" format "YYYY-mm-dd", e.g., "1999-02-01". year years select, e.g., year = 1998:2004 select 1998-2004 inclusive, year = c(1998, 2004) select 1998 2004. month months select. Can either numeric, e.g., month = 1:6 select January June, name, e.g., month = c("January", "December"). time.freq time period average . Default “hour”, can also “day”, “week”, “month”, “year”. method Method calculate UHI intensity. Options include "LCZ" "manual". Turban Urban station references, method "manual" selected. Trural Rural station references, method "manual" selected. time-series split option. Options include “year”, “season”, “seasonyear”, “month”, “monthyear”, “weekday”, “weekend”, “site”, “daylight”, “dst” (daylight saving time). See type argument openair package: https://bookdown.org/david_carslaw/openair/sections/intro/openair-package.html#-type-option. impute Method impute missing values. Options include “mean”, “median”, “knn”, “bag”. group TRUE urban, rural UHI - related temperatures grouped plot. iplot Set TRUE return plot. FALSE, data frame returned. isave Set TRUE save results (plot, time-series, station references) directory. ylab label y-axis. xlab label x-axis. Default “Time”. ylab2 label right y-axis. title title plot. Default empty string. caption source data caption.
